    <dd><p>Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition to the task. If no value is specified, the tags are not propagated. Tags can only be propagated to the task during task creation. The only valid value is: <code>TASK_DEFINITION</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tags_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#tags_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">map[string]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to ecs resources.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="taskcount_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#taskcount_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Task<wbr>Count</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The number of tasks to create based on the TaskDefinition. Defaults to <code>1</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="java">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="taskdefinitionarn_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#taskdefinitionarn_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">task<wbr>Definition<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The ARN of the task definition to use if the event target is an Amazon ECS cluster.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="capacityproviderstrategies_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#capacityproviderstrategies_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">capacity<wbr>Provider<wbr>Strategies</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#eventtargetecstargetcapacityproviderstrategy">List&lt;Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Target<wbr>Capacity<wbr>Provider<wbr>Strategy&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The capacity provider strategy to use for the task. If a <code>capacity_provider_strategy</code> specified, the <code>launch_type</code> parameter must be omitted. If no <code>capacity_provider_strategy</code> or <code>launch_type</code> is specified, the default capacity provider strategy for the cluster is used. Can be one or more. See below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="enableecsmanagedtags_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#enableecsmanagedtags_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">enable<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Managed<wbr>Tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the task.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="enableexecutecommand_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#enableexecutecommand_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">enable<wbr>Execute<wbr>Command</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Whether or not to enable the execute command functionality for the containers in this task. If true, this enables execute command functionality on all containers in the task.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="group_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#group_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">group</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies an ECS task group for the task. The maximum length is 255 characters.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="launchtype_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#launchtype_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">launch<wbr>Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the launch type on which your task is running. The launch type that you specify here must match one of the launch type (compatibilities) of the target task. Valid values include: <code>EC2</code>, <code>EXTERNAL</code>, or <code>FARGATE</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="networkconfiguration_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#networkconfiguration_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">network<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#eventtargetecstargetnetworkconfiguration">Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Target<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Use this if the ECS task uses the awsvpc network mode. This specifies the VPC subnets and security groups associated with the task, and whether a public IP address is to be used. Required if <code>launch_type</code> is <code>FARGATE</code> because the awsvpc mode is required for Fargate tasks.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="orderedplacementstrategies_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#orderedplacementstrategies_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">ordered<wbr>Placement<wbr>Strategies</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

    </dt>
    <dd><p>An array of placement strategy objects to use for the task. You can specify a maximum of five strategy rules per task.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="placementconstraints_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#placementconstraints_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">placement<wbr>Constraints</a>

        <span class="property-type"><a href="#eventtargetecstargetplacementconstraint">List&lt;Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Target<wbr>Placement<wbr>Constraint&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>An array of placement constraint objects to use for the task. You can specify up to 10 constraints per task (including constraints in the task definition and those specified at runtime). See Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="platformversion_java">

For more information about valid platform versions, see <a href="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/platform_versions.html">AWS Fargate Platform Versions</a>.</p>

</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the launch type on which your task is running. The launch type that you specify here must match one of the launch type (compatibilities) of the target task. Valid values include: <code>EC2</code>, <code>EXTERNAL</code>, or <code>FARGATE</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="networkconfiguration_yaml">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#eventtargetecstargetnetworkconfiguration">Property Map</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Use this if the ECS task uses the awsvpc network mode. This specifies the VPC subnets and security groups associated with the task, and whether a public IP address is to be used. Required if <code>launch_type</code> is <code>FARGATE</code> because the awsvpc mode is required for Fargate tasks.</p>

            title="Optional">

    </dt>

</dd><dt class="property-optional"

    </dt>
    <dd><p>An array of placement constraint objects to use for the task. You can specify up to 10 constraints per task (including constraints in the task definition and those specified at runtime). See Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="platformversion_yaml">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition to the task. If no value is specified, the tags are not propagated. Tags can only be propagated to the task during task creation. The only valid value is: <code>TASK_DEFINITION</code>.</p>

<h4 id="eventtargetecstargetcapacityproviderstrategy">Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Target<wbr>Capacity<wbr>Provider<wbr>Strategy</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="capacityprovider_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#capacityprovider_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Capacity<wbr>Provider</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Short name of the capacity provider.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="base_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#base_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Base</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The base value designates how many tasks, at a minimum, to run on the specified capacity provider. Only one capacity provider in a capacity provider strategy can have a base defined. Defaults to <code>0</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="weight_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#weight_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Weight</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The weight value designates the relative percentage of the total number of tasks launched that should use the specified capacity provider. The weight value is taken into consideration after the base value, if defined, is satisfied.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="eventtargetecstargetorderedplacementstrategy">Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Ecs<wbr>Target<wbr>Ordered<wbr>Placement<wbr>Strategy</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="type_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#type_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Type of placement strategy. The only valid values at this time are <code>binpack</code>, <code>random</code> and <code>spread</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="field_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#field_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Field</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The field to apply the placement strategy against. For the <code>spread</code> placement strategy, valid values are <code>instanceId</code> (or <code>host</code>, which has the same effect), or any platform or custom attribute that is applied to a container instance, such as <code>attribute:ecs.availability-zone</code>. For the <code>binpack</code> placement strategy, valid values are <code>cpu</code> and <code>memory</code>. For the <code>random</code> placement strategy, this field is not used. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/task-placement-strategies.html">Amazon ECS task placement strategies</a>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<li>The keys can't start with &quot;AWS&quot;.</li>
</ul>
</dd></dl>

<h4 id="eventtargetruncommandtarget">Event<wbr>Target<wbr>Run<wbr>Command<wbr>Target</h4>

<div>

            title="Required">
        <span id="key_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#key_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Can be either <code>tag:tag-key</code> or <code>InstanceIds</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="values_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#values_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Values</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>If Key is <code>tag:tag-key</code>, Values is a list of tag values. If Key is <code>InstanceIds</code>, Values is a list of Amazon EC2 instance IDs.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

    <dd><p>Can be either <code>tag:tag-key</code> or <code>InstanceIds</code>.</p>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import EventBridge Targets using `event_bus_name/rule-name/target-id` (if you omit `event_bus_name`, the `default` event bus will be used). For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:cloudwatch/eventTarget:EventTarget test-event-target rule-name/target-id
```
